intro: Stenanthium gramineum var. micranthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thread-leaf, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Melanthiaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance and showy, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. The species is noted for its ornamental value and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
